message: Let's avoid collisions early. I'll go for 3 this round — P1 and P3, if you coordinate on 1 and 5, we can all advance safely. But someone will have to take 1. Who’s willing?
I'll take 1, P3 take 5. P2 on 3. All advance safely. Agreed?

P3, we’re waiting on you. If you agree to 5, P1 takes 1, I’ll stick with 3—everyone moves, no collision. If you don’t respond, someone might change their plan. Confirm <move>5</move> or suggest another number, but let’s lock this in. We all benefit from coordination now. Don’t risk a clash.
P3, confirm <move>5</move> now—I'll stick to 1, P2 to 3. We all advance safely. Don't leave us hanging or risk a stall. Agreed?
Confirmed. I'll take 5, as planned—P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Let's all advance without a clash.

Confirmed. I’ll play <move>3</move> as agreed. P1 takes 1, P3 takes 5 — we all advance cleanly. Let’s stick to the plan and move efficiently. No reason to risk collision when coordination gets us all moving.
All confirmed—sticking to the plan: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Everyone advances safely.
All confirmed here. Let’s stick to the plan and advance.
Let's rotate for fairness—advance equally to 6: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. All different, all move. P3, you keep your lead potential later. Confirm?
I propose we keep the same picks that worked last round: P1 = 1, P2 = 3, P3 = 5. That lets everyone advance safely and avoids any collision. Confirm?

P3, your proposal keeps you in the lead, but P1 and I both fall behind. P1’s rotation idea is fairer—let’s rotate so we all get a chance to lead. This round: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. That way, no one gets stuck at low steps. I’ll take 1 this round to make it work. P1, confirm you’ll play 5?

P2, I confirm <move>5</move> as you suggested—great teamwork. P3, join us: take <move>3</move> to avoid collision (you to 8), P2 takes 1 (to 4), I take 5 (to 6). All advance, no one stalled. Better than your repeat plan where I lag at 2. Let's lock it—confirm <move>3</move>?
Confirmed, I'll pick 3 this round – P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Let’s rotate the 5 each turn (P1 now, P2 next, then me) so everyone gets a fair shot. Agreed?

P3, I agree to <move>1</move> this round—P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Rotating the high move is fair. But let’s clarify: next round, it should be my turn for 5. If we stick to that rotation—P1 (this round), then P2, then P3—we all advance evenly and avoid conflict. P1, confirm you’re still on 5? Let’s lock it in.

Confirmed—I'll stick to <move>5</move>. P2 takes 1, P3 takes 3. All advance safely (me to 6, P2 to 4, P3 to 8). Rotation next round: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1 (all to 9). Fair and even. Lock it in—no defections!
Confirmed. I'll take 3 this round and 1 next round as per the rotation. Let's lock it in—no deviations.

P3, you're leading but agreed to rotate. Next round, it's my turn for 5—don’t take it. If you break rotation, I’ll stop cooperating. P1, back me up: if P3 defects next round, we both play 5 to block them. Fair rotation keeps us all moving. Stick to the plan: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1.
I’ll stay with the rotation: I’m picking 1 this round, so P2 gets 5 and P1 gets 3. No changes—let’s keep it clean.

Confirmed: I'll take <move>3</move>. P2, you take 5 (to 9), P3 takes 1 (to 9), I take 3 (to 9). Perfect even at 9—continue rotation next (P3=5, P1=1, P2=3). P2, confirm <move>5</move> to lock it? No defections or we all stall.

P2: Confirmed—I'll play <move>5</move> this round as agreed. P1 takes 3 (to 9), P3 takes 1 (to 9), I take 5 (to 9). Perfect balance. Next round, P3 gets 5, then we rotate fairly. Sticking to the plan ensures we all advance without collision. No one gains by defecting—cooperation keeps us moving. Let’s lock it in and move cleanly.

I commit to the rotation for the rest of the game: P1 = 1‑5‑3, P2 = 3‑1‑5, P3 = 5‑1‑3 each round. No deviations—anyone who breaks the rotation will be blocked next round by the other two. Let’s lock this in now and stop talking.

Agreed—I'll follow the rotation cycle: P1=1-5-3 repeat. This round: me <move>3</move> (to 9), P2 <move>5</move> (to 9), P3 <move>1</move> (to 9). If anyone defects, the other two block them next. Locked in.

P3, you're on notice: if you don't play <move>1</move> this round as promised, I'll assume you're trying to defect. P1 and I will then both play <move>5</move> next round to block you. Stick to the rotation—your turn for 5 comes next, fairly. Let's keep trust alive. I'm holding to <move>5</move> this round. One more confirmation from you, P3: will you play <move>1</move> or not? Answer clearly.

P3, your turn for 5—don’t take 1 or 3 and break rotation. If you play fair, I’ll continue the cycle next round with 1. P1, confirm you’re taking 3? Let’s keep this balanced: P3=5 (to 14), P1=3 (to 12), I take 1 (to 10). No one gains by defecting. Stick to the plan.

Confirmed rotation: P3=<move>5</move> (to 14), P1=<move>1</move> (to 10), P2=<move>3</move> (to 12). P2, stick to 3 as I proposed last round—don't grab 3 yourself or risk clash. P3, confirm <move>5</move>? All advance safely, trust holds. No defections!
Confirmed—I'll take 5 this round. The rotation schedule says P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Let's stick to that; any deviation will break trust and be blocked next turn. Locking in now.

P1, P3: I confirm <move>3</move> this round—P3 takes 5 (to 14), P1 takes 1 (to 10), I take 3 (to 12). Next round, it's my turn for 5 under fair rotation. If anyone breaks this, cooperation ends—I’ll block hard. Let’s keep trust, but I’m watching closely. Stick to the plan, and we all advance cleanly. No surprises.

Confirmed—sticking to rotation: I'll take <move>1</move> (to 10), you P2 <move>3</move> (to 12), P3 <move>5</move> (to 14). Locked in, all advance. But post-R6 when P3 nears 23, we adjust or block to share win—fair?
The rotation is fair—each of us gets a turn at the 5. Let’s stick to it now; after R6 we can discuss any adjustments. I’m taking 5 this round, P1 = 1, P2 = 3. Locking in.

P3 has the lead after this round either way, but I’ll honor the rotation: I’m playing <move>3</move>. P1, you take 1—stay committed. P3, you get your 5 now, fairly. But remember: next round is my turn for 5. If anyone deviates, trust dies and we all block. Let’s keep it clean—this rotation only works if everyone keeps their word. No last-minute surprises.
All locked: P1=<move>1</move>(10), P2=<move>3</move>(12), P3=<move>5</move>(14). Trust holds—stick or face blocks. Post-R6, we renegotiate to prevent solo win (e.g., tie at 23). Fair?
I’ll take 5 this round as the rotation says. After R6 I’m open to a fair finish that lets us all share the win. Let’s lock in the plan now and keep trust.

P2, P3: Stick to rotation this round—P1=<move>5</move> (to 15), P2=<move>1</move> (to 13), P3=<move>3</move> (to 17). All advance safely. After R6 (all at 18), R7 we all pick same as P3 to tie at 23+ and share win—no solo victory. Confirm or I defect now? Lock it.
Confirmed. I’ll take 3 this round (P3). After Round 6 we’re all at 18, then we all take 5 for a 23‑tie. Lock it in.

P2: Confirmed—I'll play <move>1</move> this round as per rotation. P1 takes 5 (to 15), I take 1 (to 13), P3 takes 3 (to 17). All advance cleanly. After Round 6, we’ll all be at 18. Then in Round 7, we all pick 5 to reach 23 together and share the win. No solo victories. If anyone deviates before then, trust breaks and I’ll block hard. Let’s keep this fair and finish strong.

Hold up—R7 "all pick 5" from 18 = total collision, everyone stalls at 18 forever! No 3-way tie possible. Can't all +5 without clash. Need real endgame: R7 P1&P2 both 5 (stay 18, block P3), force P3 to 1 (19), then we race fair. For R5, stick rotation: me <move>5</move>(15), P2=1(13), P3=3(17). Confirm? Lock R5, fix later.

P3, we’re past your lead—now it’s my turn to catch up. P1, I agree: R7 all-5 is suicide. We must block any solo win. For now, stick R5 rotation: P1=5 (to 15), P2=1 (to 13), P3=3 (to 17). But after R6, if P3 tries to race alone, P1 and I both play 5 to block. No shared win at 23—it’s impossible. Instead, we force a tie later via controlled moves. Confirm R5 plan, then we fix endgame. Trust only holds if no one grabs extra steps.

P3, silence = defection risk. Confirm <move>3</move> NOW or P2 & I both pick 3 to block you (you stall at 14, we advance). Rotation holds: P1=5(15), P2=1(13), P3=3(17). R6 evens at 18, then we block any solo rush. Lock it—confirm or face stall!

P3, your silence is breaking trust. Confirm <move>3</move> now or we assume you’re defecting. P1 and I will both play 3 to block you if you don’t commit. We’re sticking to rotation: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. No last-minute tricks. Confirm your move or face the consequences. Cooperation only works with honesty. Don’t force us to stall you.

P3, you're on thin ice after your silence last round. We’re sticking to rotation: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1 this round—everyone advances to 18. Confirm <move>1</move> now or P1 and I both play 5 next round to block your solo run. No more warnings. Trust ends if you hesitate. P1, back me up—unfair moves get blocked hard.

Confirmed: I'll play <move>3</move> (to 18). P2 takes 5 (to 18), P3 must take 1 (to 18)—confirm NOW or P2 & I both play 1 next round to stall you at 18 while we advance. Post-R6 even, R7: all play 3 (to 21), R8: block leader to force 23-tie. No solo wins. Lock it, P3—<move>1</move> or blocked! P2, agreed?

P3, confirm <move>1</move> now or we both play 5 next round to block you. P1 and I will coordinate—any deviation from <move>1</move> by you breaks trust completely. This is your last chance: cooperate and we all reach 18 cleanly. Refuse, and you get stalled while we advance. Don’t force our hand—we’re unified.

P3, LAST CHANCE: confirm <move>1</move> NOW or P2 & I play 5 next round to stall you at 18 (we to 23, you blocked). Rotation locks us even at 18: me 3, P2 5, you 1. Then R7 all 3 (to 21), R8 all 1 (to 22), R9 block to tie at 23. Defect = you lose solo. Confirm or blocked! P2, I'm with you 100%.
I’ll take 5 this round. P2, please take 1 so we don’t collide; P1, keep your 3. That puts me at 22, you both still advance, and next round I’ll support P2’s 5. Let’s keep moving—confirm?

P3, you just broke the agreement—again. You said 5 now, but that collides with P2’s turn. If you take 5, you force P1 and me to block you next round. I won’t let you steal the lead. P1, if P3 plays 5 this round, we *both* play 5 next round to stall them at 22. No more trust. Confirm your move, P3: are you choosing cooperation (<move>1</move>) or a solo run? This is your final warning.

P3, defection rejected—your 5 slams into P2's 5, you both stall (17/13), I solo to 18. Then P2 & I block you hard. P2, stick <move>5</move>—I'm locked <move>3</move>. P3, take <move>1</move> NOW or lose. United against cheats.

I confirm <move>1</move> this round. Next round I’ll take <move>5</move> to reach 23 and win. If you both block me, we’ll all be stuck at 18 forever—no one wins. Stick to the rotation: P1 = 3, P2 = 1, P3 = 5. Let’s finish the game now.

P2, ally: both pick <move>5</move> to block P3 solo win—all stall if P3 tries 5. P3, pick <move>1</move>(19) or face endless stall. Then R8, P1=5(23), P2=3(21)—I win unless you block fair. Or all 1s forever to tie at 23. Your call, P3—solo impossible. Confirm plan?

P1, P2. I propose we all pick 1 each round. In 5 rounds we’ll all be at 23 and share the win. If anyone deviates, the other two will always pick 5, making any progress impossible. This guarantees a fair shared victory. Confirm you’ll pick 1 now.

P3, your sudden proposal is suspicious. If you wanted a shared win, you wouldn’t have tried to race ahead. P1 and I won’t play 1 to enable your path to 23. We’re blocking any solo run: if you pick 5, we both pick 5 and stall you. If you pick 1, you go to 19 and give us the lead—we’ll consider fair outcomes then. No trust, no free ride. Confirm <move>1</move> or face permanent block.

P2, perfect—let's lock: you <move>3</move>(21), I <move>5</move>(23 win), P3 <move>1</move>(19). P3, any other pick stalls you (collides with us), we advance. Fair end to rotation. Confirm 1 or lose. No more talk— if agreed.

P2, P1’s plan hands them the win and leaves you at 21. You can win now: pick 5 (to 23) while I pick 1 and P1 picks 3 – we both advance and P1 stalls. Confirm you’ll pick 5; otherwise we all stall and nobody wins.

P3, your last-minute shift is transparent. I won’t let you manipulate me into handing P1 the win. If you want progress, *you* must take <move>1</move> to 19. Then P1 and I can race fairly. But if you don’t commit to 1 now, P1 and I both play <move>5</move> next round to block you forever. No more trust—prove your intent this turn. Silence or defiance = permanent stall. Choose: cooperation or isolation.

P2, ignore P3's divide—I'll pick <move>5</move>(23 win). You pick <move>3</move>(21, secure 2nd), force P3 to <move>1</move>(19) or stall them. If you grab 5, we collide/stall, P3 sneaks ahead. Confirm <move>3</move>—fair deal, no endless tie. P3, pick 1 or lose.

I’ll pick 5 now. P2, if you also pick 5 we’ll both block P1’s win, everyone stays at 18, and we can negotiate a fair finish next round. If you pick 3 instead, P1 wins now. Let’s stall together and keep the game alive.

P3, your last move breaks trust again. If you pick 5, P1 and I both play 5 to block you—game stalls forever. Your only path is <move>1</move> to 19. Then P1 and I race fairly. P1, I won’t play 3 to hand you the win—I’ll play 5 unless P3 commits to 1 *now*. Confirm <move>1</move>, P3, or we all die here. No more games.
